intro: Steiranisia heterantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a preference for well-draining soil. Steiranisia heterantha thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture to flourish.
